original: sngar bshad pa'i cho gas yi ge mu: ser po yongs su gyur pa las 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa zhal gsum phyag drug pa ste /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i cho gas yi ge mu: ser po yongs su gyur pa las 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa zhal gsum phyag drug pa ste /
translated: Through the rite explained previously, the yellow syllable muṃ transforms into Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta with three faces and six arms.

original: zhal gur gum 'od kyi mdog dang / g-yas pa dang cig shos ni snon po dang dkar po /
analyzed: zhal gur gum 'od kyi mdog dang / g-yas pa dang cig shos ni snon po dang dkar po /
translated: His faces are the color of saffron, the right and left are white and red.

original: sems dpa'i skyil krung gis bzhugs pa /
analyzed: sems dpa'i skyil krung gis bzhugs pa /
translated: He sits in the sattva posture.

original: g-yas pa'i phyag gsum ni ral gri dang / mda' dang mchog sbyin pa dang ldan la /
analyzed: g-yas pa'i phyag gsum ni ral gri dang / mda' dang mchog sbyin pa dang ldan la /
translated: The three right hands hold a sword, arrow, and boon-granting mudra.

original: g-yon pa'i phyag gsum na ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam dang / gzhu dang / autpala sngon pos brel zhing /
analyzed: g-yon pa'i phyag gsum na ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam dang / gzhu dang / autpala sngon pos brel zhing /
translated: The three left hands hold a volume of the Perfection of Wisdom, a bow, and a blue utpala flower.

original: sgeg pa'i nyams bag dang ldan pa'i gzhon nu'i rgyan dang / na bza' la sogs pa can /
analyzed: sgeg pa'i nyams bag dang ldan pa'i gzhon nu'i rgyan dang / na bza' la sogs pa can /
translated: He is adorned with the ornaments, garments, and so forth of a youthful prince, and he is full of charm.

original: me tog la sogs pas mdzes pa chen por gyur pa'i zur phud gsum gyis rnam par mdzes pa /
analyzed: me tog la sogs pas mdzes pa chen por gyur pa'i zur phud gsum gyis rnam par mdzes pa /
translated: He is beautified by three locks of hair, one on the crown of his head and one on each shoulder, which are adorned with flowers and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdul phra rab las grub par bdag nyid bsgoms la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdul phra rab las grub par bdag nyid bsgoms la /
translated: One should meditate on oneself as being composed of the particles of the Tathāgata.

original: aom mu: zhes bya ba'i sngags 'di bzlas par bya ba'o //
analyzed: aom mu: zhes bya ba'i sngags 'di bzlas par bya ba'o //
translated: One should recite this mantra, “Oṃ muḥ.”

original: aa bha ya'i zhal snga nas dge slong tshul khrims rgyal mtshan gyis bsgyur ba'o//
analyzed: aa bha ya'i zhal snga nas dge slong tshul khrims rgyal mtshan gyis bsgyur ba'o//
